meanings.definition: To fold or arrange in multiple layers or sections.
meanings.sent1: She was manifolding the paper to create a paper crane.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys manifolding his clothes neatly in the drawer.
meanings.sent3: The manifolding of the napkins at the restaurant made them look like little sculptures.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was manifolding thoughts like origami, each one intricate and delicate.
meanings.sent5: The artist was manifolding the clay into a beautiful vase, layer by layer.

meanings.definition: The process of creating multiple copies or versions of something.
meanings.sent1: The manifolding of the report was necessary for distribution to all team members.
meanings.sent2: The manifolding of the brochure allowed for wider dissemination of information.
meanings.sent3: The manifolding of the cake recipe resulted in delicious treats for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The manifolding of ideas in brainstorming sessions leads to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The manifolding of the document ensured that everyone had a copy for reference.

meanings.definition: The act of expanding or increasing in size or scope.
meanings.sent1: The manifolding of the company led to its rapid growth in the market.
meanings.sent2: The manifolding of responsibilities at work can be overwhelming but rewarding.
meanings.sent3: The manifolding of the balloon made it soar higher into the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, manifolding in joy and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The manifolding of the garden brought new colors and scents with each bloom.
